roleset.name: cause an increase in rate (of growth, us.)
roleset.note: FUEL-V NOTES: Frames file for 'fuel' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. No access to verbnet. No comparison. (from fuel.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: instrumental subject
example.text: [The sale]-1 is likely *trace*-1 to fuel concern about growing Japanese investment in U.S. biotechnology firms.
example.arg: concern about growing Japanese investment in U.S. biotechnology firms

example.name: passivized instrumental subject
example.text: [The earnings growth]-1 also was fueled *trace*-1 by the company's ability to cut net financing spending by half to around 15 million guilders.
example.arg: by the company's ability to cut net financing spending by half to around 15 million guilders

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1 and ARG2
example.text: At a meeting Friday , the Kremlin leader complained about recent articles that raised the possiblity of civil unrest , and accused the media of fueling panic buying of goods by publishing stories about impending shortages .
example.arg: by publishing stories about impending shortages
